P_deg.desc: This is the position of the eyes in degrees on the screen.
P_deg.name: Position in Degrees

P_deg_centered.desc: This is the position of the eyes in degrees on the screen.
P_deg_centered.name: Position in Degrees Centered

P_deg_f.desc: This is the position of the eyes in degrees on the screen. A filter has been applied
P_deg_f.name: Bias

framerate.desc: This is the refresh rate of the screen, the result is in frames per second, aka in hertz(hz)
framerate.name: Framerate in Hertz

px_per_deg.desc: This is the amount of pixels on the screen per degrees
px_per_deg.name: Pixels per degrees

screen_height_cm.desc: This is the height of the screen, aka horizontal size, in centimeters, this cannot be calculated afaik, user input required
screen_height_cm.name: Screen height in centimeters

screen_height_deg.desc: This is the height of the screen, aka horizontal size, in degrees
screen_height_deg.name: Screen Height in degrees

screen_height_px.desc: This is the height of the screen, aka horizontal size, in pixels
screen_height_px.name: Screen Height in pixels

screen_width_cm.desc: This is the width of the screen, aka horizontal size, in centimeters, this cannot be calculated afaik, user input required
screen_width_cm.name: Screen width in centimeters

screen_width_deg.desc: This is the width of the screen, aka horizontal size, in degrees
screen_width_deg.name: Screen width in degrees

screen_width_px.desc: This is the width of the screen, aka horizontal size, in pixels
screen_width_px.name: Screen width in pixels

viewing_Distance_cm.desc: This is the distance between the test subject's eyes and the screen, this cannot be calculated afaik, user input required
viewing_Distance_cm.name: Viewing Distance in cm

V_deg.desc: This is the velocity of the eye in degrees
V_deg.name: Velocity in degrees

V_deg_NaN.desc: This is the velocity of the eye in degrees after suppressing saccades
V_deg_NaN.name: Velocity in degrees, suppressed saccades

V_deg_f.desc: This is the velocity of the eye in degrees, it is using filtered position data
V_deg_f.name: Velocity in degrees, filtered pos

V_deg_f_NaN.desc: This is the velocity of the eye in degrees after suppressing saccades, it is using filtered position data
V_deg_f_NaN.name: Velocity in degrees, filtered pos, suppressed saccades

V_deg_f_f.desc: This is the filtered velocity of the eye in degrees, it is using filtered position data
V_deg_f_f.name: Filtered Velocity in degrees, filtered pos

V_deg_f_f_NaN.desc: This is the filtered velocity of the eye in degrees after suppressing saccades, it is using filtered position data
V_deg_f_f_NaN.name: Filtered Velocity in degrees, filtered pos, suppressed saccades

bias.desc: I am unsure tbh... i will have to ask
bias.name: Bias

dir_target.desc: This is the direction of the target. AFAIK, it is only bidirectionnal, so it is only -1 or 1, respectively left and right (not sure?)
dir_target.name: Directon of the target

microSaccades.desc: These are microSaccades that are not detected by the eyelink, they are calculated with a velocity check
microSaccades.name: microSaccades
